title: Edmund Husserl
summary: Edmund Gustav Albrecht Husserl (/ˈhʊsɜːrl/ HUUSS-url,[18][19] US also /ˈhuːsɜːrl, ˈhʊsərəl/ HOO-surl, HUUSS-ər-əl,[20][21] German: [ˈɛtmʊnt ˈhʊsɐl];[22] 8 April 1859 – 27 April 1938[23]) was a German[24][25] philosopher and mathematician who established the school of phenomenology.
